Lesson 3: Great Start to Quality: Process for Continuous Improvement

The process of quality improvement never ends. There is always new research and learning in the field of Early Care and Education and in the new process, programs are encouraged and supported to continue to reflect on their practices, in line with the program’s philosophy. This can assist programs in creating goals for improvement to ensure the best quality care for the children and families they serve.

Additional Resources: GSQ also provides robust resources for child care providers and families through ten Resource Centers that include:

  • Free professional development and training opportunities, including in-person, and virtual options. 

  • A free Lending Library that offers themed kits, curriculum, administrative books, books on child development, DVDs, books, CDs, gross motor items, and more. 

  • Support from a Quality Improvement Specialist (QIS) to help programs navigate Great Start to Quality

  • Support to families searching for child care and preschool that best meets their needs. 

  • Free on-site, individual coaching from a Quality Improvement Coach (QIC) to support home and center-based early learning programs in providing high quality care to children and families.
